metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1080 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Dogtag PKI, through version 10.6.1, has a vulnerability in AAclAuthz.java that, under certain configurations, causes the application of ACL allow and deny rules to be reversed. If a server is configured to process allow rules before deny rules (authz.evaluateOrder=allow,deny), then allow rules will deny access and deny rules will grant access. This may result in an escalation of privileges or have other unintended consequences.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1080` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

dogtag-pki - 10.6.0-1ubuntu1
dogtag-pki-console-theme - 10.6.0-1ubuntu1
dogtag-pki-server-theme - 10.6.0-1ubuntu1
libsymkey-java - 10.6.0-1ubuntu1
libsymkey-jni - 10.6.0-1ubuntu1
pki-base - 10.6.0-1ubuntu1
pki-base-java - 10.6.0-1ubuntu1
pki-ca - 10.6.0-1ubuntu1
pki-console - 10.6.0-1ubuntu1
pki-javadoc - 10.6.0-1ubuntu1
pki-kra - 10.6.0-1ubuntu1
pki-ocsp - 10.6.0-1ubuntu1
pki-server - 10.6.0-1ubuntu1
pki-tks - 10.6.0-1ubuntu1
pki-tools - 10.6.0-1ubuntu1
pki-tps - 10.6.0-1ubuntu1
pki-tps-client - 10.6.0-1ubuntu1
python3-pki-base - 10.6.0-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: dogtag-pki package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '10.6.0-1ubuntu1').
